Class org.ingatan.component.librarymanager.TableQuestionOptionPane extends javax.swing.JPanel implements Serializable

Serialized Fields

askStyle

javax.swing.JSpinner askStyle
The ask style determines how the questions will be asked at quiz time. A question taken from the first column can be put to the user, and the answer can then be typed. This is the written style. Alternatively, multiple choice questions can automatically be generated from the other data in the table. This is good for the early stages of learning. Both methods may be used, in which case they are used randomly during quiz time.

askInReverse

javax.swing.JCheckBox askInReverse
If this is checked then, at quiz time, questions will be generated from both columns, rather than just one. This is useful for vocabulary training, where the user would not want to rote learn just Spanish to Swedish, for example, but also Swedish to Spanish.

fwdQuestionTemplate

SimpleTextField fwdQuestionTemplate
The question template allows the user to set a template for each question, where the data taken from the table is substituted into the template. This makes things a little nicer than just being presented with a word.

bwdQuestionTemplate

SimpleTextField bwdQuestionTemplate
The question template allows the user to set a template for each question, where the data taken from the table is substituted into the template. This makes things a little nicer than just being presented with a word. This is a second, bwd (backward) template. This field only appears if the 'can ask in reverse' checkbox is ticked.

listener

java.awt.event.ActionListener listener
listener that is notified when the fonts combo box changes value.

marksPerAnswer

NumericJTextField marksPerAnswer
Number of marks to award per correct answer.

spinnerFonts

javax.swing.JSpinner spinnerFonts
Font chooser combo box.

spinnerFontSize

javax.swing.JSpinner spinnerFontSize
Spinner for font size.

lblAskStyle

javax.swing.JLabel lblAskStyle
"Answer field to use" label.

lblNumberMarks

javax.swing.JLabel lblNumberMarks
"Marks per correct answer:" label.

lblForwardTemplate

javax.swing.JLabel lblForwardTemplate
"Question template (forward)" label.

lblBackwardTemplate

javax.swing.JLabel lblBackwardTemplate
"Question template (backward)" label.

lblFont

javax.swing.JLabel lblFont
"Font:" label.

Class org.ingatan.component.quiztime.QuizWindow extends javax.swing.JFrame implements Serializable

Serialized Fields

questionArea

RichTextArea questionArea
Displays the question text.

answerArea

RichTextArea answerArea
Displays the answer text.

btnContinue

javax.swing.JButton btnContinue
Used to grade the question and show the post data text, or show the next question

btnSkip

javax.swing.JButton btnSkip
Used to skip the current question and load the next question.

returnToOnClose

javax.swing.JFrame returnToOnClose
This window is set visible before the QuizWindow is disposed.

contentPane

javax.swing.JPanel contentPane
Content pane for the quiz window.

lblQuestionFrom

javax.swing.JLabel lblQuestionFrom
Label that displays where the currently displayed question is taken from.

quizManager

QuizManager quizManager
The quiz manager taking care of question loading, sorting, and saving, etc.

sideBar

javax.swing.JPanel sideBar
JPanel with a painted border, used as the side panel to display statistics and the user's current score.

currentQuestion

IQuestion currentQuestion
The currently displayed question.

isShowingQuestion

boolean isShowingQuestion
Whether or not the question is being displayed (true value) or the post-answer text is being displayed.

totalQuestionsAnswered

int totalQuestionsAnswered
Keeps track of how many questions have been asked since the quiz started.

totalQuestionsSkipped

int totalQuestionsSkipped
Keeps track of how many questions have been skipped since the quiz started.

totalMarksAvailable

int totalMarksAvailable
Keeps track of how many marks have been available for the user to win.

totalMarksAwarded

int totalMarksAwarded
Keeps track of the total number of marks that have been awarded to the user.

totalScore

int totalScore
Keeps track of the user's score so far.

comboCounter

int comboCounter
Is incremeneted until the user gets less than 0.95 for a question and it is reset to 0. When scoring, if the combo counter is > 3, a bonus is added.

comboIncidenceCounter

int comboIncidenceCounter
Counts how many times individual combos have occurred.

quizHasEnded

boolean quizHasEnded
This is set when the end screen is shown. The continue button checks this flag and will dispose the quiz window upon click event if this flag is set to true.

improvementCount

int improvementCount
Keeps track of how may times the user improved on the historic correctness of a question.

currentAnswerFields

java.util.ArrayList<E> currentAnswerFields
The number of answer fields that currently exist in the answer text area. This is set when a new question is displayed.

sizeStep

int sizeStep
Used in the displayNextQuestion method. This is a workaround for resizing the question and answer areas properly, until a better solution can be found. The areas only truly resize nicely when the quiz window is resized. This variable is multiplied by -1 each time it is used, and each time a question is asked, the quiz window is resized by adding this value (1 or -1). This keeps the window at the same size, but also means the text fields are resized appropriately.

Package org.ingatan.component.text

Class org.ingatan.component.text.DataTable extends javax.swing.JTable implements Serializable

Serialized Fields

synchronisedData

org.ingatan.component.text.DataTable.SynchronisedData synchronisedData
The synchronised data array will be altered accordingly as changes are made to the data table. For example, if the user deletes row 5 of the table, then element 5 of all the synchronised data ArrayLists will be deleted too. Copy, paste and cut ops are also taken into account. Each ArrayList you add is treated as a column.

editor

SimpleTextField editor
Table cell editor.

mtce

DataTable.CustomTableCellEditor mtce
Custom table cell editor allowing for automatic selection upon edit mode, and other custom behaviour.

tblModel

javax.swing.table.DefaultTableModel tblModel
Table model for this table. The override simply adds the custom cell editor whenever the setDataVector method is called.

enterMovesLeftToRight

boolean enterMovesLeftToRight
Whether the enter key moves the cell selection to next column, or whether it moves the selection down a row.

The symbol menu used by this text field.

symbolMenuActivateKey

javax.swing.KeyStroke symbolMenuActivateKey
This is the key that is pressed to activate the symbol menu. Once the symbol menu is activated, the next keystrok will display the symbol menu and all corresponding special characters. Default is F1.

menuActivated

boolean menuActivated
Value set to true when the activating keystroke has been heard. The next keystroke will determine the base character for the symbol menu.

Package org.jdom.xpath

Class org.jdom.xpath.XPath extends java.lang.Object implements Serializable

Serialization Methods

writeReplace

protected final java.lang.Object writeReplace()
                                       throws java.io.ObjectStreamException
[Serialization support] Returns the alternative object to write to the stream when serializing this object. This method returns an instance of a dedicated nested class to serialize XPath expressions independently of the concrete implementation being used.

Note: Subclasses are not allowed to override this method to ensure valid serialization of all implementations.

Throws:
java.io.ObjectStreamException - never.
